attributes.action: AWARD POSTHUMOUSLY THE MILITARY CROSS TO WALTER TULL WHO WAS THE FIRST COLOURED MAN TO GAIN A COMMISSION IN THE BRITISH ARMY
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Walter Tull was the grandson of a politician.  He was a professional football and played for Tottenham Hotspur.  At the outset of WW1 he joined the British Army.  Because of his exceptional leadship skills he was recommended for officer training.  He became the very first coloured man to be awarded a commission.  He was kia in 1918.  He was recommened for the Military Cross but was nevery awarded it.  I would like to petition for  this to be awarded to him posthumously and given to his surviving family

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Ministry of Defence.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
